items.standfirst: Donald Trump's plan for ending the war in Ukraine would hand swathes of land to Russia and limit the size of Kyiv's military, a draft has revealed.
items.content: Donald Trump's plan for ending the war in Ukraine would hand swathes of land to Russia and limit the size of Kyiv's military, a draft has revealed.

items.title: US-backed plan would hand eastern territory to Russia, Zelensky calls for 'dignified peace'
items.standfirst: The plan put forward by the United States to end the war in Ukraine calls, among other measures, for Kyiv to cede the regions of the Donbas in the country's east to Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Thursday appealed for a “dignified peace”, as Russia claimed to have captured the stronghold of Kupiansk.
items.content: The plan put forward by the United States to end the war in Ukraine calls, among other measures, for Kyiv to cede the regions of the Donbas in the country's east to Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Thursday appealed for a “dignified peace”, as Russia claimed to have captured the stronghold of Kupiansk.

items.content: Kyiv said it plans to "work on points of the plan." it received from the U.S. that's aimed at restarting diplomatic efforts to end the war in Ukraine.

ai_summary: A draft plan requires Ukraine to offer territory and security concessions to Moscow.
Russia would be readmitted to the G8 and receive sanctions relief under the plan.
Trump and Zelensky may discuss the plan in a phone call next week.
Ukraine is ready to work with the plan but has "red lines" regarding territory.
The plan would hand swathes of land to Russia and limit Kyiv's military.

clusters.title: Frida Kahlo painting sells for record $54.7m
clusters.neutral_headline: Frida Kahlo Painting Sells for Record $54.7 Million

items.title: Frida Kahlo painting sells for record $54.7m
items.standfirst: A 1940 self-portrait titled ‘The dream’ by famed Mexican artist Frida Kahlo has sold for $54.7m.
items.content: A 1940 self-portrait titled ‘The dream’ by famed Mexican artist Frida Kahlo has sold for $54.7m.

items.title: Frida Kahlo painting sells for $54.7m, breaking record for female artists
items.standfirst: A 1940 self-portrait by Frida Kahlo has sold for $54.7m and made auction history at Sotheby’s in New York.
items.content: A 1940 self-portrait by Frida Kahlo has sold for $54.7m and made auction history at Sotheby’s in New York.

items.title: Frida Kahlo self-portrait sells for record-breaking $55m
items.standfirst: The auction shattered the previous record for a price tag fetched for a work by a female artist.
items.content: The auction shattered the previous record for a price tag fetched for a work by a female artist.

items.title: Frida Kahlo self-portrait sells for $54.7 million, sets new record for women artists
items.standfirst: Frida Kahlo’s 1940 self-portrait “El sueno (La cama)” sold for $54.66 million in New York on Thursday, Sotheby’s said, setting a record for the most expensive painting by a woman.
items.content: Frida Kahlo’s 1940 self-portrait “El sueno (La cama)” sold for $54.66 million in New York on Thursday, Sotheby’s said, setting a record for the most expensive painting by a woman.

items.title: Frida Kahlo self-portrait sells for $54.7 million, shattering record for female artists
items.standfirst: A 1940 self-portrait by Frida Kahlo has sold for $54.7 million and made auction history at Sotheby's in New York.
items.content: A 1940 self-portrait by Frida Kahlo has sold for $54.7 million and made auction history at Sotheby's in New York.

items.title: Frida Kahlo self-portrait sells for $54.7m to set new auction record for a female artist
items.standfirst: The 1940 painting of Kahlo asleep in bed has surpassed the record set by the $44.4m sale of Georgia O’Keeffe’s Jimson Weed/White Flower No. 1 in 2014A 1940 self-portrait by famed Mexican artist Frida Kahlo has sold for $54.7m (£41.8m, A$84.7m) at a New York art auction, setting a new top sale price for a work by any female artist.El sueño (La cama), or The Dream (The Bed), which depicts Kahlo asleep in a bed with a smiling skeleton wrapped in dynamite on the canopy above her, sold on Thursday night at a Sotheby’s auction of surrealist art after four minutes of bidding. Continue reading...
items.content: The 1940 painting of Kahlo asleep in bed has surpassed the record set by the $44.4m sale of Georgia O’Keeffe’s Jimson Weed/White Flower No. 1 in 2014A 1940 self-portrait by famed Mexican artist Frida Kahlo has sold for $54.7m (£41.8m, A$84.7m) at a New York art auction, setting a new top sale price for a work by any female artist.El sueño (La cama), or The Dream (The Bed), which depicts Kahlo asleep in a bed with a smiling skeleton wrapped in dynamite on the canopy above her, sold on Thursday night at a Sotheby’s auction of surrealist art after four minutes of bidding. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A Frida Kahlo self-portrait, "The Dream," sold for $54.7 million at auction.
The sale set a new record for the most expensive painting by a female artist.
The auction took place at Sotheby's in New York.
The painting depicts Kahlo asleep in bed with a skeleton above her.
The sale surpassed the previous record of $44.4 million for a Georgia O'Keeffe painting.

items.standfirst: Fatima Bosch Fernandez, of Mexico, has been crowned Miss Universe 2025, rounding off a dramatic and controversy-ridden competition in Bangkok.
items.content: Fatima Bosch Fernandez, of Mexico, has been crowned Miss Universe 2025, rounding off a dramatic and controversy-ridden competition in Bangkok.

items.title: Mexico's Fatima Bosch wins chaotic Miss Universe pageant marred by insults, falls and protests
items.standfirst: Fatima Bosch of Mexico was crowned Miss Universe 2025 on Friday, capping a turbulent 74th edition of the popular beauty pageant in Thailand that saw one judge allege vote-rigging, a contestant rushed to hospital after a fall and the 25-year-old Miss Mexico stand up to public bullying from one of the hosts.
items.content: Fatima Bosch of Mexico was crowned Miss Universe 2025 on Friday, capping a turbulent 74th edition of the popular beauty pageant in Thailand that saw one judge allege vote-rigging, a contestant rushed to hospital after a fall and the 25-year-old Miss Mexico stand up to public bullying from one of the hosts.

items.standfirst: A scandal-filled pageant season ends with the crowning of a new Miss Universe in Bangkok, Thailand.
items.content: A scandal-filled pageant season ends with the crowning of a new Miss Universe in Bangkok, Thailand.

items.content: She went from walking out after being publicly chided by the pageant’s co-owner to being crowned its 74th victor

The pageant was marked by controversy, including alleged vote-rigging.
One contestant was rushed to the hospital after a fall.
Miss Mexico walked out after being publicly chided by the pageant's co-owner.
The pageant was filled with insults and protests.

clusters.title: Pras Michel of the Fugees sentenced to 14 years over illegal campaign donations

items.title: Pras Michel of the Fugees sentenced to 14 years over illegal campaign donations
items.standfirst: The Grammy-winning artist was sentenced on Thursday to 14 years in prison for a case in which he was convicted of illegally funneling foreign contributions to former President Obama's 2012 campaign.
items.content: The Grammy-winning artist was sentenced on Thursday to 14 years in prison for a case in which he was convicted of illegally funneling foreign contributions to former President Obama's 2012 campaign.(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)

items.title: Fugees rapper sentenced to 14 years in prison over illegal Obama donations

items.content: Justice Department prosecutors accused Grammy-winning rapper Pras Michel of betraying his country for money.

items.title: Grammy-winning rapper jailed for 14 years
items.standfirst: A Grammy-winning rapper who "betrayed his country for money" has been sentenced to 14 years in prison.
items.content: A Grammy-winning rapper who "betrayed his country for money" has been sentenced to 14 years in prison.

items.title: Fugees rapper sentenced to 14 years for illegal Obama campaign contributions
items.standfirst: Rapper Prakazrel "Pras" Michel of the Fugees has been sentenced to 14 years in prison for a case in which he was convicted of illegally funneling millions of dollars in foreign contributions to the 2012 Obama campaign.
items.content: Rapper Prakazrel "Pras" Michel of the Fugees has been sentenced to 14 years in prison for a case in which he was convicted of illegally funneling millions of dollars in foreign contributions to the 2012 Obama campaign.

items.title: Fugees rapper Pras sentenced to 14 years in prison over illegal donations to Obama campaign
items.standfirst: Prakazrel ‘Pras’ Michel was convicted in 2023 after a trial that included testimony from actor Leonardo DiCaprio and former US attorney general Jeff SessionsThe Grammy-winning rapper Prakazrel “Pras” Michel of the Fugees has been sentenced to 14 years in prison for a case in which he was convicted of illegally funnelling millions of dollars in foreign contributions to former US president Barack Obama’s 2012 reelection campaign.Michel, 52, declined to address the court before US district judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly sentenced him on Thursday. Continue reading...
items.content: Prakazrel ‘Pras’ Michel was convicted in 2023 after a trial that included testimony from actor Leonardo DiCaprio and former US attorney general Jeff SessionsThe Grammy-winning rapper Prakazrel “Pras” Michel of the Fugees has been sentenced to 14 years in prison for a case in which he was convicted of illegally funnelling millions of dollars in foreign contributions to former US president Barack Obama’s 2012 reelection campaign.Michel, 52, declined to address the court before US district judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly sentenced him on Thursday. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Pras Michel of the Fugees was sentenced to 14 years in prison.
He was convicted of illegally funneling foreign contributions.
The contributions were made to former President Obama's 2012 campaign.
Prosecutors accused Michel of betraying his country for money.
The trial included testimony from Leonardo DiCaprio and Jeff Sessions.

clusters.title: Households in Great Britain face surprise rise in energy bills from January
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Households Face Increased Energy Bills in January

items.title: Households in Great Britain face surprise rise in energy bills from January
items.standfirst: Energy price cap for average dual fuel bill will increase to £1,758 a year, from £1,755 in the current quarterBusiness live – latest updatesEnergy bills will rise for millions of households in Great Britain from January, after the industry regulator announced a surprise increase in gas and electricity costs.The energy regulator, Ofgem, said on Friday that the quarterly price cap covering January to March will rise by 0.2% for the average annual dual fuel energy bill to £1,758, from £1,755 in the current quarter. Continue reading...
items.content: Energy price cap for average dual fuel bill will increase to £1,758 a year, from £1,755 in the current quarterBusiness live – latest updatesEnergy bills will rise for millions of households in Great Britain from January, after the industry regulator announced a surprise increase in gas and electricity costs.The energy regulator, Ofgem, said on Friday that the quarterly price cap covering January to March will rise by 0.2% for the average annual dual fuel energy bill to £1,758, from £1,755 in the current quarter. Continue reading...

items.content: Regulator Ofgem says a change in the price cap in January means a 0.2% increase in gas and electricity prices.

items.standfirst: Energy prices to edge up in January as temperatures plunge Millions of households will see a slight rise in gas and electricity prices at the height of winter, after regulator Ofgem outlined its next price cap. The 0.2% increase from the current cap will take effect at the start of January, and…
items.content: Energy prices to edge up in January as temperatures plunge Millions of households will see a slight rise in gas and electricity prices at the height of winter, after regulator Ofgem outlined its next price cap. The 0.2% increase from the current cap will take effect at the start of January, and…

ai_summary: The energy price cap will increase in January.
The increase is 0.2% for the average dual fuel energy bill.
The price cap will be £1,758 a year, up from £1,755.
The increase is unexpected.
The rise comes as temperatures are expected to drop.

clusters.title: Separatist leader Kanu sentenced to life in prison in Nigeria

items.title: Separatist leader Kanu sentenced to life in prison in Nigeria
items.standfirst: Separatist leader Nnamdi Kanu shouted in protest at a court hearing in Nigeria, before he was sentenced to life.
items.content: Separatist leader Nnamdi Kanu shouted in protest at a court hearing in Nigeria, before he was sentenced to life.

items.title: Nigerian separatist leader sentenced to life for terrorism
items.standfirst: Nnamdi Kanu is found guilty of inciting violence as part of his campaign for a separate state in south-east Nigeria.
items.content: Nnamdi Kanu is found guilty of inciting violence as part of his campaign for a separate state in south-east Nigeria.

items.title: Biafran separatist leader sentenced to life on terrorism charges by Nigerian court
items.standfirst: Judge says Nnamdi Kanu used his Indigenous People of Biafra group to incite attacks on security officials and civiliansThe Biafran separatist leader Nnamdi Kanu has been sentenced to life in prison on terrorism-related charges by a court in the Nigerian capital, Abuja.Judge James Omotosho said prosecutors had shown that Kanu, who also holds British citizenship, had used his Indigenous People of Biafra group (Ipob) to incite attacks on security officials and civilians in south-east Nigeria and during anti-police protests in Lagos. Continue reading...
items.content: Judge says Nnamdi Kanu used his Indigenous People of Biafra group to incite attacks on security officials and civiliansThe Biafran separatist leader Nnamdi Kanu has been sentenced to life in prison on terrorism-related charges by a court in the Nigerian capital, Abuja.Judge James Omotosho said prosecutors had shown that Kanu, who also holds British citizenship, had used his Indigenous People of Biafra group (Ipob) to incite attacks on security officials and civilians in south-east Nigeria and during anti-police protests in Lagos. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Nnamdi Kanu, a separatist leader, was sentenced to life in prison.
He was found guilty of inciting violence and terrorism.
Kanu's group, Indigenous People of Biafra, was used to incite attacks.
The attacks were against security officials and civilians.
Kanu also holds British citizenship.

items.title: Nigeria hit by second school abduction in less than a week

items.content: Armed men attacked a Catholic school in Nigeria's north-central Niger state and abducted an unspecified number of schoolchildren, authorities said Friday, just days after 25 schoolgirls were kidnapped in neighbouring Kebbi state.

ai_summary: Armed men abducted students from a Catholic school in Nigeria.

25 schoolgirls were kidnapped in a previous attack.

clusters.title: First in Africa: What to know about the G20 summit boycotted by Trump
clusters.neutral_headline: US in Talks to Attend G20 Summit After Initial Boycott

items.title: First in Africa: What to know about the G20 summit boycotted by Trump
items.standfirst: Leaders from the G20 group of the world's largest economies meet this weekend for a summit in South Africa – the first on African soil. US President Donald Trump said he would boycott the event over his widely dismissed claims that the host country is persecuting its Afrikaner white minority.
items.content: Leaders from the G20 group of the world's largest economies meet this weekend for a summit in South Africa – the first on African soil. US President Donald Trump said he would boycott the event over his widely dismissed claims that the host country is persecuting its Afrikaner white minority.

items.title: US in talks to attend G20 summit after initial boycott, South Africa says
items.standfirst: Cyril Ramaphosa says US has had ‘change of mind’ but does not confirm Trump’s attendance in JohannesburgThe US has changed its mind about attending the G20 summit in Johannesburg, South Africa’s president has said, without confirming whether Donald Trump, who had said the US would boycott the event, now wanted to come.Trump has claimed that South Africa racially discriminates against the minority white Afrikaner community, which led the country during the apartheid regime that ended in 1994. Continue reading...
items.content: Cyril Ramaphosa says US has had ‘change of mind’ but does not confirm Trump’s attendance in JohannesburgThe US has changed its mind about attending the G20 summit in Johannesburg, South Africa’s president has said, without confirming whether Donald Trump, who had said the US would boycott the event, now wanted to come.Trump has claimed that South Africa racially discriminates against the minority white Afrikaner community, which led the country during the apartheid regime that ended in 1994. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The G20 summit will be held in South Africa.
Donald Trump initially said the US would boycott the event.
The US is now in talks to attend the summit.
Trump claimed South Africa racially discriminates against Afrikaners.

clusters.title: UK retail sales drop unexpectedly as shoppers await Black Friday and budget
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Retail Sales Drop Unexpectedly

items.title: UK retail sales drop unexpectedly as shoppers await Black Friday and budget
items.standfirst: Supermarkets, clothing stores and online mail order firms suffer sales declines as consumers delay purchasesBusiness live – latest updatesSales at UK retailers slumped unexpectedly last month as shoppers waited for Black Friday deals, and uncertainty over the upcoming budget dampened consumer confidence.Retail sales fell 1.1% month on month in October, the first fall since May, according to official figures from the Office for National Statistics (ONS). Economists had been expecting sales growth to be flat on the previous month. Continue reading...
items.content: Supermarkets, clothing stores and online mail order firms suffer sales declines as consumers delay purchasesBusiness live – latest updatesSales at UK retailers slumped unexpectedly last month as shoppers waited for Black Friday deals, and uncertainty over the upcoming budget dampened consumer confidence.Retail sales fell 1.1% month on month in October, the first fall since May, according to official figures from the Office for National Statistics (ONS). Economists had been expecting sales growth to be flat on the previous month. Continue reading...

items.title: UK government borrows more than expected in setback before budget
items.standfirst: October figures represent final snapshot of public finances before Rachel Reeves’s tax and spending statementBusiness live – latest updatesThe UK government borrowed more than expected in October, official figures show, in the final snapshot of the public finances before Rachel Reeves’s crunch budget.The Office for National Statistics said borrowing – the difference between public spending and income – was £17.4bn last month. Continue reading...

items.content: Supermarkets, clothing stores and online mail order firms suffer sales declines as consumers delay purchases Business live – latest updates Sales at UK retailers slumped unexpectedly last month as shoppers waited for Black Friday deals, and uncertainty over the upcoming budget dampened consumer…

ai_summary: UK retail sales fell unexpectedly in October.
Sales declined by 1.1% month over month.
Consumers are delaying purchases.
Shoppers are waiting for Black Friday deals.
Uncertainty over the upcoming budget also dampened confidence.

items.title: California Governor Race: Eric Swalwell Announces Run on 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!'
items.standfirst: Democratic Representative Eric Swalwell announced during an appearance on Jimmy Kimmel Live! that he was running for California governor, entering a crowded race to succeed the term-limited Gavin Newsom. This is a breaking news story and will be updated.
items.content: Democratic Representative Eric Swalwell announced during an appearance on Jimmy Kimmel Live! that he was running for California governor, entering a crowded race to succeed the term-limited Gavin Newsom. This is a breaking news story and will be updated.

items.title: Democratic Rep. Eric Swalwell running for California governor
items.standfirst: Democratic Rep. Eric Swalwell, who has been a leading critic of the Trump administration, announced on Thursday that he is running for governor of California in the 2026 election.
items.content: Democratic Rep. Eric Swalwell, who has been a leading critic of the Trump administration, announced on Thursday that he is running for governor of California in the 2026 election.

ai_summary: Democratic Representative Eric Swalwell announced his candidacy for California governor on Jimmy Kimmel Live.
Swalwell is entering a crowded race to succeed the term-limited Gavin Newsom in the 2026 election.
He has been a leading critic of the Trump administration.
The announcement was made on Thursday.
This is a developing news story.

clusters.title: Trump admin. announces plan for new oil drilling off California, Florida coasts

items.title: Trump admin. announces plan for new oil drilling off California, Florida coasts
items.standfirst: The Trump administration is proposing new oil drilling off the California and Florida coasts for the first time in decades, as President Trump seeks to expand U.S. oil production.
items.content: The Trump administration is proposing new oil drilling off the California and Florida coasts for the first time in decades, as President Trump seeks to expand U.S. oil production.

items.title: Trump Plan Targets Florida, California for Coastal Oil Drilling
items.standfirst: The Trump administration is proposing to open new areas off of California, Florida and Alaska to crude drilling as part of a draft blueprint released Thursday that would dramatically expand the sale of oil and natural gas rights.
items.content: The Trump administration is proposing to open new areas off of California, Florida and Alaska to crude drilling as part of a draft blueprint released Thursday that would dramatically expand the sale of oil and natural gas rights.

ai_summary: The Trump administration is proposing new oil drilling off California and Florida coasts.
This is the first time in decades such drilling has been proposed.
The plan is part of a draft blueprint to expand oil and natural gas rights.
The proposal also targets Alaska for crude drilling.
The administration seeks to expand U.S. oil production.

clusters.title: U.S. retiree freed after years jailed in Saudi Arabia for critical tweets
clusters.neutral_headline: Saudi Arabia releases US retiree jailed over critical tweets

items.title: U.S. retiree freed after years jailed in Saudi Arabia for critical tweets
items.standfirst: A U.S. retiree held in Saudi Arabia over critical tweets has been freed months ahead of schedule, his son said, a day after Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman appeared hand in hand with President Donald Trump at the White House."Our family is overjoyed that, after four long years, our father, Saad Almadi, is finally on his way home," his family said in a statement his son Ibrahim posted Wednesday on X. Riyadh authorities jailed and then banned Saad Almadi, 75, from leaving the country two years ag
items.content: A U.S. retiree held in Saudi Arabia over critical tweets has been freed months ahead of schedule, his son said, a day after Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman appeared hand in hand with President Donald Trump at the White House."Our family is overjoyed that, after four long years, our father, Saad Almadi, is finally on his way home," his family said in a statement his son Ibrahim posted Wednesday on X. Riyadh authorities jailed and then banned Saad Almadi, 75, from leaving the country two years ag

items.title: Saudi Arabia releases US retiree jailed over critical tweets
items.standfirst: Saad Almadi’s family thanks Trump and state department as announcement comes after meeting with crown princeSaudi Arabia has agreed to allow US citizen Saad Almadi to return home to Florida, five months ahead of the scheduled lifting of travel restrictions and a day after Saudi crown prince and prime minister Mohammed bin Salman met Donald Trump at the White House.Almadi, 75, was sentenced to 19 years of incarceration in the kingdom in 2021 after he wrote 14 tweets critical of the Riyadh government. Two years later, the charges were reduced to so-called “cyber crimes” and he was sentenced to a 30-year ban on leaving Saudi Arabia. Continue reading...
items.content: Saad Almadi’s family thanks Trump and state department as announcement comes after meeting with crown princeSaudi Arabia has agreed to allow US citizen Saad Almadi to return home to Florida, five months ahead of the scheduled lifting of travel restrictions and a day after Saudi crown prince and prime minister Mohammed bin Salman met Donald Trump at the White House.Almadi, 75, was sentenced to 19 years of incarceration in the kingdom in 2021 after he wrote 14 tweets critical of the Riyadh government. Two years later, the charges were reduced to so-called “cyber crimes” and he was sentenced to a 30-year ban on leaving Saudi Arabia. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Saudi Arabia released U.S. retiree Saad Almadi, months ahead of schedule.
Almadi was jailed for tweets critical of the Riyadh government.
His family thanked Trump and the State Department.
The release came after a meeting with Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.
Almadi was sentenced to 19 years in 2021, later reduced to a travel ban.
